par.text: Rhenium is a silvery-white, dense and very hard metal. Roasted rhenium becomes soft and malleable. Metallic rhenium is unaffected by oxygen, nitrogen, hydrogen and acids, including hydrochloric acid. However, it reacts with nitric(V) acid. Rhenium begins to react with oxygen at 1000
C to produce rhenium(VII) oxide – R

. Rhenium was discovered by the German chemists Ida and Walter Noddack and Otto Karl Berg in 1925. The existence of rhenium was predicted in 1871 by Dmitri Mendeleyev. The element was named after the river Rhine.
